| Chemical |
| --- |
| Hypercalcemia |
| Mood stabilizers |

Hypercalcemia is a condition characterized by an elevated level of calcium in the blood. Mood stabilizers are a type of medication used to treat mood disorders such as bipolar disorder and borderline personality disorder. Arrhythmia refers to an irregular heart rhythm, but it is not a chemical entity.
